attributes.action: Stop the plan to include calorie counts on menus
attributes.additional_details: By including calorie counts on menus will immensely increase anxiety around eating out for those who suffer with eating disorders. Calories are not a constructive way to determine the nutritional value of food- it will only cause triggers & disordered behaviours. Thus, leading to the extreme detriment of mental and physical health.
attributes.background: There are 1.25 million people in the UK who suffer with eating disorders - to include calorie counts on menus would have a detrimental effect on these people’s mental & physical health. Going out for food is meant to be a pleasurable experience, not determined by the amount of calories you consume.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585685
